floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teme, River Onny, River Corve

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Onibury river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall forecast Friday today and tomorrow Saturday 25/12/21.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 04:00 tomorrow morning, 25/12/21.  We believe there is a possibility of flooding for low lying land and roads adjacent the River Teme, River Onny and River Corve and their tributaries. Locations that may be affected include Bishops Castle, Church Stretton, Knighton and Ludlow. Predicted peaks:-  Onibury 1.6m to 1.8m Saturday morning 25/12/21.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours with another band of rain expected Saturday evening 25/12/21, which will cause river levels to rise again.  We expect river levels to remain high until 26/12/21.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning 25/12/21 by 09:00, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Clay Coton river gauge as a result of expected rainfall over the next 24 hours. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tonight Friday 24/12/2021 into tomorrow Saturday 25/12/2021. Flooding is forecast to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to River Avon between Stanford and Rugby, River Swift between Cosford and Rugby and Clay Coton Brook between Yelvertoft and Lilbourne
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Little Alne river gauge as a result of expected rainfall over the next 24 hours. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tonight Friday 24/12/2021 into tomorrow Saturday 25/12/2021. Flooding is forecast to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Arrow between Studley and Salford Priors and the River Alne between Bird in Hand and Alcester on the River Alne including farmland and caravan parks.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

Heavy rain is expected in the Upper Nene area this evening and is expected to continue overnight. This means that levels in the River Nene and associated tributaries will rise, which will lead to flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river from the early hours of Saturday morning, 25th December, onwards. We expect the river to remain high throughout the weekend as further rain is forecast Saturday evening. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are constantly monitoring river levels, and have staff in the field checking for blockages and clearing weedscreens. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated on the morning of Saturday, 25th December, or as the situation changes.

The flood alert for the North Sea coast at Bridlington has been issued. Overtopping waves and spray are expected as a result of strong onshore winds for the North Sea coast at Bridlington. Overtopping waves are expected on Saturday morning, 25/12/2021 between 10.30am and 11.15am particularly around Bridlington South Pier and Lifeboat Station. Overtopping waves are also expected on Saturday evening between 19:45pm and 01:00am on Sunday 26/12/2021. Please be careful along beaches, coastal and estuary footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated on Saturday morning, 25/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Cappenham river gauge as a result of recent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible to begin around 02:30am tomorrow, 25/12/21.  We expect flooding to affect the River Tove from Towcester to Cosgrove, including Silverstone Brook   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to continue rising. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Alne at Chapel Lane and Church Lane in Aston Cantlow and Great Alne
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Little Alne river gauge as a result of rainfall overnight and in the early hours of today, Saturday 25/12/2021. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and low lying land is possible today, 25/12/2021.     
We expect river levels to rise until later this afternoon, with further rainfall expected this morning, 25/12/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please activate any property flood protection products you may have, such as flood barriers and air brick covers, and avoid contact with flood water.
This message will be updated in 8 hours, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Arrow and River Alne at Alcester and Oversley Mill
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Little Alne river gauge as a result of rainfall overnight and in the early hours of today, Saturday 25/12/2021. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible today, 25/12/2021.  Flooding is likely to affect properties on The Mill Industrial Park and around Arden Road, Springfields Road, School Road, Moorfield Road, Fairwater Crescent to St Mary's Road, Oversley Green, Mill Lane, Arrow Court & Arrow Mill.   
Further rainfall is forecast today, 25/12/2021.  
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please activate any property flood protection products you may have, such as flood barriers and air brick covers, and avoid contact with flood water.
This message will be updated in 8 hours, or as the situation changes.

Due to wet weather yesterday and overnight river levels have risen and have reacted today, Saturday 25 December. 
The main area of concern is currently Abridge where river levels have risen the most. There is likely to be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. Flooding from surface water, where water gathers and flows off road surfaces, could also occur. 
You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
There is further rain expected today and overnight, we expect the river to remain high over the weekend. No flooding to properties is currently expected.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff on standby to attend to any blockages in the river.
This message will be updated this evening or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Colne and Radlett Brook
items.message:
Due to wet weather yesterday and overnight river levels have risen and have reacted to overnight showers today, Saturday 25 December. 
The main area of concern is currently Colney Heath where river levels have risen the most. There is likely to be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. Flooding from surface water, where water gathers and flows off road surfaces, could also occur. 
You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
There is further rain expected today and overnight, we expect the river to remain high over the weekend. No flooding to properties is currently expected.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff on standby to attend to any blockages in the river.
This message will be updated this evening or earlier if the situation changes

River levels have risen at the Perdiswell river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected from 04:00 today, 25/12/21.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent the Barbourne Brook from the M5 to Barbourne including Perdiswell and Blackpole Industrial Estate.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 17:00 today, 25/12/21, or as the situation changes.

We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Catshill to Hawford. Other areas that may be affected include Stoke Heath, Elmley Lovett, Droitwich Spa and Ombersley.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.
